ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Thinking aboout a typical night in the last month... How long does it take you to fall asleep?
Notes: 0= Greater than or equal to 61 minutes; 1= 46-60 minutes; 2= 31-45 minutes; 3= 16-30 minutes; 4= 0-15 minutes; 99= Chose not to respond

ElementDescription: Thinking aboout a typical night in the last month... If you then wake up during the night how long are you awake for in total?
Notes: 0= Greater than or equal to 61 minutes; 1= 46-60 minutes; 2= 31-45 minutes; 3= 16-30 minutes; 4= 0-15 minutes; 99= Chose not to respond

ElementDescription: Thinking aboout a typical night in the last month... How many nights a week do you have a problem with your sleep?
Thinking aboout a typical night in the last month... How would you rate your sleep quality?
Notes: 0= Very poor; 1= Poor; 2= Average; 3= Good; 4= Very good; 99= Chose not to respond

ElementDescription: Thinking aboout the past month, to what extent has poor sleep... Affected your mood energy or relationships?
Notes: 0= Very much; 1= Much; 2= Somewhat; 3= A little; 4= Not at all; 99= Chose not to respond

ElementDescription: Thinking aboout the past month, to what extent has poor sleep... Affected your concentration productivity or avility to stay awake?
Notes: 0= Very much; 1= Much; 2= Somewhat; 3= A little; 4= Not at all; 99= Chose not to respond

ElementDescription: Thinking aboout the past month, to what extent has poor sleep... Troubled you in general?
Notes: 0= Very much; 1= Much; 2= Somewhat; 3= A little; 4= Not at all; 99= Chose not to respond

ElementDescription: Finally... How long have you had a problem with your sleep?
Notes: 0= Greater than 1 year; 1= 7-12 months; 2= 3-6 months; 3= 1-2 months; 4= I don't have a problem or less than one month; 99= Chose not to respond

ElementDescription: Short Form Sleep Condition Indicator (SCI-02) - Total Score
Sleep Condition Indicator - Total Score out of 10
